intro: Linosyris intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate linosyris, is a flowering plant native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. It produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, and its leaves are alternate, lobed, and often hairy. Linosyris intermedia is an annual or biennial herb that is sometimes considered a weed due to its rapid growth and adaptability.
